mapper.sql: id, mobile, content, check_code, send_time, send_type, ip, is_validate
mapper.select: SELECT * FROM app_sms WHERE mobile = #{phone} ORDER BY send_time DESC LIMIT 1
mapper.insert: insert into app_sms (id, mobile, content, check_code, send_time, send_type, ip, is_validate) values (#{id,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{mobile,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{content,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{checkCode,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{sendTime,jdbcType=BIGINT}, #{sendType,jdbcType=TINYINT}, #{ip,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{isValidate,jdbcType=VARCHAR})

id,

mapper.update:
update app_sms
mobile = #{mobile,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
content = #{content,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
check_code = #{checkCode,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
send_time = #{sendTime,jdbcType=BIGINT},
send_type = #{sendType,jdbcType=TINYINT},
ip = #{ip,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
is_validate = #{isValidate,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
where id = #{id,jdbcType=VARCHAR}

update app_sms set mobile = #{mobile,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, content = #{content,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, check_code = #{checkCode,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, send_time = #{sendTime,jdbcType=BIGINT}, send_type = #{sendType,jdbcType=TINYINT}, ip = #{ip,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, is_validate = #{isValidate,jdbcType=VARCHAR} where id = #{id,jdbcType=VARCHAR}
mapper.select:
select
from app_sms c
where 1=1
and c.id = #{id}
and c.mobile like concat ('%', #{mobile},'%')
and c.content like concat ('%', #{content},'%')

select
from app_sms c
where 1=1
and c.id = #{id}
and c.mobile like concat ('%', #{mobile},'%')
and c.content like concat ('%', #{content},'%')
